title: Three killed in Warrensville Heights barbershop shooting
content:
WARRENSVILLE HEIGHTS, Ohio -- Three people are dead following a late Thursday shooting at a barbershop.
Brandon White, 31, of Warrensville Heights, William Gonzalez, 32, of Garfield Heights, and Walter Barfield, 23, of Cleveland, all died during the shooting at Chalk Linez Barbershop on Harvard Road.
All three were taken to South Pointe Hospital, where they were pronounced dead, according to the Cuyahoga County Medical Examiner. Their deaths are being treated as suspected homicides.
Warrensville Heights police have been at the scene investigating the shooting throughout the night. They have not commented or returned messages.
James Box, a Cleveland social activist, said on Thursday he knows Gonzalez and identified him as the barbershop's owner.
